result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaniqua S Alexander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
COURT WILL CONSIDER MOTION FOR EXPUNGEMENT IN 1 YEAR IF DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES SENTENCE AND HAS NO FURTHER VIOLATIONS OF THE LAW

- Defendant to complete 40 hours of community service.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent, if any is needed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shaniqua S Alexander in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements as to sentencing by defense and state.
Court withheld sentence, defendant is given credit for -0- days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for 6 months with the following conditions:
 - Defendant to complete 40 hours of community service.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined by the agent, if any is needed.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. 
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
  Court will consider motion for expungement in 1 year if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.

Defendant Shaniqua S Alexander in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is calendared for a jury trial today.
Defendant now wants to change his plea.
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shaniqua S Alexander in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
State's witness list received and filed.
Attorney Hagner appeared earlier, but left.
The defendant informed the court that she had car trouble.
Court will not issue a bench warrant but ordered the defendant to appear for her jury trial on time in Branch 36 on 09/09/2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Shaniqua S Alexander in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM031360  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-13-15
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jermaine R.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Defendant Shaniqua S Alexander in court.  Jacob Daniel Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.     

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Br. 23 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/15 @ 1:30pm
